dashboard.name: Manage Warehouse and Inventory (Outbound) in SAP EWM

children.name: Get an Overview of your Extended-Warehouse-Management (EWM) (Basic) Outbound Process

blocks.text: This Dashboard provides a high-level overview of an Extended-Warehouse-Management (EWM) Outbound process. It highlights some key KPIs as well as a high-level analysis of the process to identify areas to investigate further.
Page 1: Discovery - A process model from your event log data, displays the most common process paths.
Page 2: Overview - Key KPIs and metrics that describe the current process state from a particular use case perspective.
Page 5: Revenue Loss due to Stock-outs
Please see our Dashboard Documentation for more information on how to manage your dashboards.

If you feel our Dashboards helped you during your analysis, please share some feedback regarding improvement ideas, wishes, and problems. We always try to improve and extend the Dashboard Templates to provide you with the best experience possible. You can submit your feedback here.

children.name: User Guide - Process Conformance checker widget
children.description: Choose this widget to (a) display various activities (b) map the process against BPMN process model

blocks.text: The aim of the Variant Explorer Widget is to discover the various process paths. You can display several variants at a time.
Before you start, make sure that a BPMN model is created via "Generate BPMN" (top right corner) or linked. Read more on how to link a BPMN process in the section Create an investigation.
For further information, check Signavio Documentation here.

dataSource.query: SELECT count(distinct "ODO Document Number") FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: Potential Revenue of ODO Items
children.description: Total Net Price of Outbound Delivery Order Items

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
SUM(CASE WHEN "SO Item Document Number" is NULL THEN NULL
ELSE  ("ODO Item Quantity")*("SO Item Net Price in Document Currency") END)
FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: Rate of ODO Items w/o WTs
children.description: Percentage of Outbound Delivery Order Items without having any Warehouse Tasks created

dataSource.query:
SELECT
COUNT(
CASE WHEN event_name MATCHES('Create Warehouse Task') THEN null
ELSE case_id
END)
/
COUNT(case_id)
*100
FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: Median Cycle Time
children.description: Median Cycle Time between first and last Event

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
MEDIAN((SELECT LAST(end_time)) - (SELECT FIRST(end_time)))
FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: ODO Item Category
children.description: Outbound Delivery Order Items per Category

children.name: Number of SO Items
children.description: Number of all Sales Order Items

dataSource.query: SELECT count(distinct "SO Item Document Number") FROM THIS_PROCESS
SELECT sum("Number of WTs") FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: Number of Outbound Delivery Order Items
children.description: Number of all Items included in Outbound Delivery Orders

dataSource.query: SELECT count(distinct case_id) FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: Number of WTs per ODO Item
children.description: Number of Warehouse Tasks per Item in Outbound Delivery Order

dataSource.query:
SELECT count(case_id) AS "No. of ODO Items", "Number of WTs" AS "No. of Warehouse Tasks"
FROM THIS_PROCESS
ORDER BY 2 asc

children.name: Average Number of WTs per ODO Item
children.description: Average Number of Warehouse Tasks per Outbound Delivery Order Item

blocks.text: This Page provides an overview of basic process elements and dimensions that are available. For key KPIs regarding selected use cases, please see the following pages.

children.name: Number of ODO Items over Time
children.description: Number of Items in Outbound Delivery Orders per Week

dataSource.query:
SELECT
    DATE_TRUNC('quarter', (SELECT FIRST(end_time))) as Week,
    count(case_id) AS "No. of ODO Items"
FROM THIS_PROCESS
ORDER BY 1 ASC NULLS FIRST
FILL TIMESERIES('QUARTER'), NULL

children.name: Event Overview
children.description: Number of Events created grouped by Event

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
event_name AS "Event Name",
count(event_name) AS "# of Events" 
FROM FLATTEN(THIS_PROCESS)
ORDER BY 2 desc

children.name: Number of ODO Items per Warehouse
children.description: Number of Outbound Delivery Orders Items managed per Warehouse

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
"ODO Item Warehouse Number",
count(case_id) AS "No. of ODO Items" FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: Average Total Cycle Time
children.description: Average Cycle Time from first Event to last Event

dataSource.query:
SELECT
AVG(
	(SELECT LAST(end_time)) - (SELECT FIRST(end_time))
    )
FROM This_Process

children.name: Median Total Cycle Time
children.description: Median Cycle Time from first Event to last Event

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
MEDIAN((SELECT LAST(end_time)) - (SELECT FIRST(end_time)))
FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: Median Cycle Time: ODO Item Creation and (last) WT completion
children.description: Median Cycle Time from Outbound Delivery Order Item creation to last completion of the Warehouse Task

children.name: Median Cycle Time: ODO Item Creation to (first) WT Creation
children.description: Median Cycle Time from Item creation in Outbound Delivery Order to first creation of the Warehouse Task

children.name: Median Cycle Time per Delivery Priority

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
"ODO Item Delivery Priority",
MEDIAN((SELECT LAST(end_time)) - (SELECT FIRST(end_time))) AS "Median Cycle Time", 
count(case_id) AS "No. of ODO Items" 
FROM THIS_PROCESS

SELECT 
"ODO Item Warehouse Number",
MEDIAN((SELECT LAST(end_time)) - (SELECT FIRST(end_time))) AS "Median Cycle Time", 
count(case_id) AS "No. of ODO Items"
FROM THIS_PROCESS

blocks.text: This page provides an overview of average and median cycle time. Focus points are: Development of cycle time over time and behavior per Warehouse and Delivery Priority.

dataSource.query:
SELECT
    DATE_TRUNC('quarter', (SELECT FIRST(end_time))) as Quarter,
   
MEDIAN((SELECT LAST(end_time)) - (SELECT FIRST(end_time))) AS "Median Cycle Time"

FROM THIS_PROCESS
ORDER BY 1 ASC NULLS FIRST
FILL TIMESERIES('QUARTER'), NULL

children.name: Rate of ODO Items with partially completed WTs
children.description: Rate of Outbound Delivery Order Items with outstanding Warehouse Task confirmations

dataSource.query:
SELECT COUNT(
CASE WHEN
(SELECT COUNT(event_name)
WHERE (event_name = 'Create Warehouse Task' )) >
(SELECT COUNT(event_name)
WHERE (event_name = 'Confirm Warehouse Task')) 
THEN case_id
ELSE Null
END)
/
COUNT(case_id)
*100
FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: Completion Rate of Warehouse Tasks for ODO Items
children.description: Rate of Outbound Delivery Order Items with confirmed Warehouse Tasks

dataSource.query:
SELECT
COUNT(
CASE WHEN
(SELECT COUNT(event_name)
WHERE (event_name = 'Create Warehouse Task' )) > 0
AND 
(SELECT COUNT(event_name)
WHERE (event_name = 'Create Warehouse Task' )) =
(SELECT COUNT(event_name)
WHERE (event_name = 'Confirm Warehouse Task')) 
THEN case_id
ELSE Null
END)
/
COUNT(case_id)
*100
FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: Median Cycle Time: ODO Item creation to last WT creation
children.description: Median Cycle Time from Outbound Delivery Item Creation to last creation of the corresponding Warehouse Task

children.name: Median Cycle Time: ODO Item creation to first WT creation
children.description: Median Cycle Time from Creation of an Outbound Delivery Item to first creation of the corresponding Warehouse Task

children.name: Optimization of Warehouse Operations - Picking
children.description: here Spezialisierung auf Picking

blocks.text: This Page provides an overview of important Insights in relation to optimizing 'Picking' 'Warehouse Operations. Focus points are: Completion of 'Picking' Warehouse Tasks and Issuing of the Goods Receipt.

children.name: Rate of ODO Items with Picking WTs completed
children.description: Rate of Outbound Delivery Items having 'Picking' Warehouse Tasks completed

dataSource.query:
SELECT COUNT(
CASE WHEN
(SELECT COUNT(event_name)
WHERE (event_name = 'Create Warehouse Task' 
AND "WT Activity Type" = 'PICK')) > 0
AND
(SELECT COUNT(event_name)
WHERE (event_name = 'Create Warehouse Task' 
AND "WT Activity Type" = 'PICK')) =
(SELECT COUNT(event_name)
WHERE (event_name = 'Confirm Warehouse Task'
AND "WT Activity Type" = 'PICK')) 
THEN case_id
ELSE Null
END)
/
COUNT(case_id)
*100
FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: Rate of ODO Items with Picking WTs completed w/o Goods Issue posted
children.description: Rate of ODO Items having 'Picking' completed without Goods Issue posted

dataSource.query:
SELECT
COUNT(
CASE WHEN
(SELECT COUNT(event_name)
WHERE (event_name = 'Create Warehouse Task' 
AND "WT Activity Type" = 'PICK')) >0
AND
(SELECT COUNT(event_name)
WHERE (event_name = 'Create Warehouse Task' 
AND "WT Activity Type" = 'PICK')) =
(SELECT COUNT(event_name)
WHERE (event_name = 'Confirm Warehouse Task' 
AND "WT Activity Type" = 'PICK')) AND 
(SELECT COUNT(event_name)
WHERE (event_name = 'Post Goods Issue')) = 0
THEN case_id
ELSE Null
END)
/ 
COUNT(case_id)
*100
FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: Rate of ODO Items w/o Picking WTs
children.description: Rate of Outbound Delivery Order Items without the Warehouse Task 'Picking'

dataSource.query:
SELECT
COUNT(
CASE WHEN
(SELECT COUNT(event_name)
WHERE (event_name = 'Create Warehouse Task' 
AND "WT Activity Type" = 'PICK')) = 0 
THEN Null
ELSE case_id
END)
/
COUNT(case_id)
*100
FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: Rate of ODO Items with Picking WTs partially completed
children.description: Rate of Outbound Delivery Items including open "Picking" Warehouse Tasks

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
COUNT(
CASE WHEN
(SELECT COUNT(event_name)
WHERE (event_name = 'Create Warehouse Task' 
AND "WT Activity Type" = 'PICK')) >
(SELECT COUNT(event_name)
WHERE (event_name = 'Confirm Warehouse Task'
AND "WT Activity Type" = 'PICK'))
THEN case_id
ELSE Null
END)
/
COUNT(case_id)
*100
FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: Optimization of Warehouse Operations - General
children.description: Satz ergänzen

blocks.text: This Page provides an overview of important Insights in relation to optimizing general Warehouse Operations. Focus Points are: Completion of Warehouse Task and Cycle Times btw ODO Item Creation and Start/ End of Warehouse Tasks.

children.name: Median Cycle Time: ODO Item Creation to first creation of Warehouse Task
children.description: Median Cycle Time Overview of Cases starting with creation of an Outbound Delivery Order to completing the first Warehouse Task

dataSource.query:
SELECT
    "ODO Item Warehouse Number",
   MEDIAN(
	(SELECT FIRST(end_time)
		WHERE event_name IN ('Create Warehouse Task')
		)
	-(SELECT LAST(end_time)
		WHERE event_name IN ('Create Outbound Delivery Order Item')
		)
	) AS "Median Cycle Time",
count(case_id) AS "No. of Cases"
FROM THIS_PROCESS
ORDER BY 3 ASC NULLS FIRST

children.name: Overview of WTs Status
children.description: Overview of different completion Status for Warehouse Task. Only Cases with Event 'Create Warehouse Task'  are considered.

dataSource.query:
SELECT 

CASE 
WHEN (
(SELECT COUNT(event_name)
WHERE event_name = 'Create Warehouse Task') > 0
AND
(SELECT COUNT(event_name)
WHERE (event_name = 'Create Warehouse Task' )) =
 (SELECT COUNT(event_name)
WHERE (event_name = 'Confirm Warehouse Task'))) 
THEN  'WTs completed'

WHEN (SELECT COUNT(event_name)
WHERE (event_name = 'Create Warehouse Task' )) >
(SELECT COUNT(event_name)
WHERE (event_name = 'Confirm Warehouse Task')) 
THEN 'WTs partially completed'

WHEN (SELECT COUNT(event_name)
WHERE (event_name = 'Create Warehouse Task' )) = 0
THEN 'W/o WTs'

ELSE NULL
END AS "WTs Status",
count (case_id) AS "No. of Cases"
FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: Overview of Picking in WTs
children.description: Status of 'Picking' Warehouse Task

dataSource.query:
SELECT 

CASE 
WHEN (
(SELECT COUNT(event_name)
WHERE (event_name = 'Create Warehouse Task') 
AND "WT Activity Type" = 'PICK')>0
AND 
(SELECT COUNT(event_name)
WHERE (event_name = 'Create Warehouse Task') 
AND "WT Activity Type" = 'PICK') =
(SELECT COUNT(event_name)
WHERE (event_name = 'Confirm Warehouse Task'
AND "WT Activity Type" = 'PICK')))
THEN 'Picking completed'

WHEN (SELECT COUNT(event_name)
WHERE (event_name = 'Create Warehouse Task' 
AND "WT Activity Type" = 'PICK')) >
(SELECT COUNT(event_name)
WHERE (event_name = 'Confirm Warehouse Task'
AND "WT Activity Type" = 'PICK'))
THEN 'Picking partially completed'

WHEN (SELECT COUNT(event_name)
WHERE (event_name = 'Create Warehouse Task' 
AND "WT Activity Type" = 'PICK')) = 0 
THEN 'W/o Picking'

ELSE NULL
END AS "Picking Status",
count (case_id) AS "# of Order Items"
FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: WT Completion Status per Warehouse
children.description: Completed Orders and Status per Warehouse. Only Cases with Events 'Create Warehouse Task' are being considered.

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
"ODO Item Warehouse Number",
COUNT(
CASE WHEN
(SELECT COUNT(event_name)
WHERE (event_name = 'Create Warehouse Task' )) >0
AND
(SELECT COUNT(event_name)
WHERE (event_name = 'Create Warehouse Task' )) =
(SELECT COUNT(event_name)
WHERE (event_name = 'Confirm Warehouse Task')) 
THEN case_id
ELSE Null
END)
/
COUNT(case_id)
*100 AS "WT Completion Status in %",
count(case_id) AS "No. of ODO Items"
FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: Median Cycle Time: ODO Item Creation and last WT completion
children.description: Median Cycle Time Overview of Cases starting with creation of an Outbound Delivery Order and finishing with completion of the last Warehouse Task

dataSource.query:
SELECT
    "ODO Item Warehouse Number",
    MEDIAN(
	(SELECT LAST(end_time)
		WHERE event_name IN ('Confirm Warehouse Task')
		)
	-(SELECT LAST(end_time)
		WHERE event_name IN ('Create Outbound Delivery Order Item')
		)
        ) AS "Median Cycle Time",
count(case_id) AS "No. of Cases"
FROM THIS_PROCESS
ORDER BY 3 ASC NULLS FIRST

children.name: WT Picking Completion Status per Warehouse
children.description: Number of Completion Status of 'Picking' Tasks per Warehouse

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
"ODO Item Warehouse Number",
COUNT(
CASE WHEN
(SELECT COUNT(event_name)
WHERE (event_name = 'Create Warehouse Task' 
AND "WT Activity Type" = 'PICK')) > 0
AND
(SELECT COUNT(event_name)
WHERE (event_name = 'Create Warehouse Task' 
AND "WT Activity Type" = 'PICK')) =
(SELECT COUNT(event_name)
WHERE (event_name = 'Confirm Warehouse Task'
AND "WT Activity Type" = 'PICK')) 
THEN case_id
ELSE Null
END)
/
COUNT(case_id)
*100 AS "WT Picking Completion Status in %",
count(case_id) AS "No. of ODO Items"
FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: Outstanding Revenue
children.description: Amount of Revenue outstanding due to Items not being shipped yet

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
SUM ( (CASE 
WHEN "ODO Item Quantity"="Total GI Quantity" THEN NULL 
WHEN "ODO Item Quantity"< "Total GI Quantity" THEN NULL
ELSE 
(CASE WHEN "SO Item Document Number" is NULL THEN NULL
ELSE  ("ODO Item Quantity"-"Total GI Quantity")*("SO Item Net Price in Document Currency") END)

END)) 
FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: Potential Revenue
children.description: Revenue of all Outbound Delivery Order Items

dataSource.query:
SELECT
SUM(CASE WHEN "SO Item Document Number" is NULL THEN NULL
ELSE  ("ODO Item Quantity")*("SO Item Net Price in Document Currency") END)
FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: Revenue
children.description: Revenue of Outbound Delivery Order Items already shipped

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
SUM (
CASE WHEN "SO Item Document Number" is NULL THEN NULL
ELSE ("Total GI Quantity")*("SO Item Net Price in Document Currency")
END
)
FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: Revenue generated per Warehouse
children.description: Revenue per Warehouse based on shipped orders

dataSource.query:
SELECT
"ODO Item Warehouse Number",
SUM (
CASE WHEN "SO Item Document Number" is NULL THEN NULL
ELSE ("Total GI Quantity")*("SO Item Net Price in Document Currency")
END
) AS "Revenue"
FROM THIS_PROCESS

blocks.text: This Page provides an overview of Revenue-related topics, both specific KPIs and graphs for a more hands-on understanding. Focus Points are: Generated Revenue compared to Potential Revenue and the Completion of the Shipment.

children.name: Shipment Rate of ODO Items (fully shipped)
children.description: Rate of Outbound Delivery Order Items where ODO quantity was fully shipped (GI quantity)

dataSource.query:
SELECT
COUNT (distinct (CASE 
WHEN "ODO Item Quantity"="Total GI Quantity" THEN "case_id"  
ELSE NULL
END)) 
/
COUNT (distinct "case_id")
*100
FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: Rate of ODO Items partially shipped
children.description: Rate of Outbound Delivery Order Items where ODO quantity was only partially shipped (GI quantity)

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
COUNT (distinct (CASE 
WHEN "ODO Item Quantity"="Total GI Quantity" THEN NULL 
WHEN "ODO Item Quantity"<"Total GI Quantity" THEN NULL 
ELSE "case_id" 
END)) 
/
COUNT (distinct "case_id")
*100
FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: Over-Delivery Rate of ODO Items
children.description: Rate of Outbound Delivery Order Items shipped in excess of the ordered quantity

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
COUNT (distinct (CASE 
WHEN "ODO Item Quantity"="Total GI Quantity" THEN NULL 
WHEN "ODO Item Quantity">"Total GI Quantity" THEN NULL 
ELSE "case_id" 
END)) 
/
COUNT (distinct "case_id")
*100
FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: Revenue generated over Time
children.description: Generated Revenue distributed over Quarters

dataSource.query:
SELECT
    DATE_TRUNC('quarter', (SELECT FIRST(end_time))) as Quarter,
    SUM (
CASE WHEN "SO Item Document Number" is NULL THEN NULL
ELSE ("Total GI Quantity")*("SO Item Net Price in Document Currency")
END
) AS "Revenue",
count(case_id) AS "No. of ODO Items"
FROM THIS_PROCESS
ORDER BY 1 ASC NULLS FIRST
FILL TIMESERIES('QUARTER'), NULL

SELECT 
case_id,
"ODO Item Quantity",
"Total GI Quantity",
(CASE 
WHEN "ODO Item Quantity"="Total GI Quantity" THEN 'Fully Delivered' 
WHEN "ODO Item Quantity">"Total GI Quantity" THEN 'Under Delivered' 
ELSE 'Over Delivered' 
END) AS "Delivery Quantity",
"SO Item Net Price in Document Currency",
SUM (
CASE WHEN "SO Item Document Number" is NULL THEN NULL
ELSE ("Total GI Quantity")*("SO Item Net Price in Document Currency")
END
) AS "Revenue"
FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: Complete Shipment Rate per Warehouse
children.description: Fully shipped orders per Warehouse

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
"ODO Item Warehouse Number",
COUNT (distinct (CASE 
WHEN "ODO Item Quantity"="Total GI Quantity" THEN "case_id"  
ELSE NULL
END)) 
/
COUNT (distinct "case_id")
*100 AS "Complete Shipment Rate in %",
count(case_id) AS "No. of ODO Items"
FROM THIS_PROCESS

SELECT 

CASE 
WHEN "ODO Item Quantity"="Total GI Quantity" THEN 'Fully delivered' 
WHEN "ODO Item Quantity">"Total GI Quantity" THEN 'Not fully delivered'
ELSE 'Over delivered'
END AS "Shipment Status",
count (case_id) AS "No. of Cases"
FROM THIS_PROCESS
ORDER BY 1

children.name: Case Table
children.description: Details of orders

blocks.text: This Page provides an overview of important Case Attributes.
